item.title: Repairing Parts for a 2,000 HP Engine
item.description: A behind-the-scenes look at repairing critical components designed for a 2,000 horsepower engine, highlighting craftsmanship and engineering standards. What goes into keeping engines of this scale running?

media:content.media:title: Repairing Parts for a 2,000 HP Engine
media:content.media:description: A behind-the-scenes look at repairing critical components designed for a 2,000 horsepower engine, highlighting craftsmanship and engineering standards. What goes into keeping engines of this scale running?

item.title: Metal Spray Repair on a CAT Crank Pulley
item.description: This video shows how metal spray repair is used to restore a CAT engine crank pulley, focusing on precision, process, and durability. How do repairs like this extend engine life?

item.title: Hydraulic Cylinder Tear-Down and Custom Spanner Build
item.description: Watch a complete hydraulic cylinder tear-down and the fabrication of a custom flogging spanner to assist with the job. This video focuses on tool creation and mechanical disassembly techniques. Do you prefer building your own specialized tools for tough jobs?

item.title: Custom Welding Upgrade for Enhanced Workshop Utility
item.description: Improve your workspace efficiency with this custom welding upgrade designed for professional workshops. This video showcases the fabrication steps taken to modernize a standard setup for better results. What is the next major upgrade you have planned for your shop?

item.title: Machining a New Barrel for a 10-Ton Forklift Cylinder
item.description: Follow the repair process for a 10-ton forklift hydraulic cylinder, including the machining of a brand-new barrel. This project combines lathe work and welding to restore essential lifting hardware. How often do you perform maintenance on your hydraulic systems?

item.title: Fabricating Heavy-Duty Rollers from Solid Steel
item.description: Follow the process of machining heavy-duty rollers from solid steel billets. This video demonstrates the precision cutting and turning required to transform raw material into durable industrial components. Have you ever worked with solid steel billets in your own shop?

item.title: Precision Line-Boring a Massive Mining Truck A-Frame
item.description: See the step-by-step process of machining heavy-duty rollers starting from solid steel billets. This video highlights the durability and precision engineering needed for industrial-grade shop tools. What is the most challenging material you have ever machined?

item.title: Precision Engineering: Custom Rolling Tool Demo
item.description: Get a close-up look at a custom-engineered rolling tool designed for precision machining. This video highlights the craftsmanship and technical assembly involved in creating specialized industrial equipment for professional fabrication. Does your workflow involve using custom-built tools like this?

item.title: Shrink-Fitting a Bearing with Liquid Nitrogen
item.description: See how liquid nitrogen is used to shrink-fit a bearing accurately and cleanly in the workshop. Why is temperature control so important in precision assembly?

item.title: Hitachi ZX470 Cylinder Rebuild Complete
item.description: The full rebuild of a Hitachi ZX470 cylinder reaches its final stage, showing the results of detailed workshop work. What does a successful rebuild really depend on?

item.title: Removing a Stubborn Gland on a CAT 24M
item.description: Watch the careful attempt to remove a seized gland from a large CAT 24M motor grader cylinder without causing damage. How much patience does a job like this require?

item.title: Repairing a Damaged Mining Truck Cylinder
item.description: A busted mining truck cylinder barrel gets a second life through careful machining and repair work. Can precision restore parts built for extreme conditions?

item.title: Excavator Repair Time in the Workshop
item.description: This video follows a hands-on excavator repair, focusing on diagnosis, machining, and practical problem-solving. What goes into keeping heavy equipment running reliably?

item.title: Can This Massive Cylinder Be Taken Apart?
item.description: A close look at the process of disassembling a large industrial cylinder, step by step and without shortcuts. What’s the safest way to tackle components this size?

item.title: Shop-Made Tools: A Custom Bearing Puller
item.description: See how a custom bearing puller is designed and built using simple shop tools. This practical approach shows problem-solving in action and highlights when making your own tool makes sense. Could this be useful in your workshop?

item.title: Meet MOAC: The Mother of All Cutters
item.description: Get a closer look at MOAC, a heavy-duty cutting tool designed for precision machining and demanding workshop tasks. This video breaks down how it works and what sets it apart. Could this be the ultimate cutter for tough jobs?

item.title: Engine Teardown for a Franna Crane
item.description: We begin a careful engine teardown as part of a Franna crane project, examining components to understand wear, faults, and next repair steps. What’s the first thing you would inspect during a teardown?

item.title: Fitting The Nut In Hydraulic Cylinder Rod
item.description: The team fits and secures the nut onto a hydraulic cylinder rod, ensuring proper alignment and a precise fit for reliable operation.

item.title: We Finished Building the Fume Extraction System!
item.description: The team completes their custom fume extraction system and puts it into operation, improving airflow and creating a safer workshop environment.

item.title: Restoring Big Excavator Arm & Bucket!
item.description: The team repairs and restores a heavily worn excavator arm and bucket, rebuilding critical areas to get the equipment ready for demanding work again.
